revised_title: A New Modification of Dirac's Time-Dependent Perturbation Theory
tldr: The article presents a modified version of Dirac's time-dependent perturbation theory that eliminates undesirable secular terms, allowing for an order-by-order calculation of the exact wavefunction for resonant harmonic perturbations and offering a simple route to establish the adiabatic hypothesis in quantum mechanics. The new formulation introduces flexibility in the choice of phase factors associated with varying amplitudes and develops a perturbation procedure that closely resembles the Brillouin-Wigner formalism in the static case.
